content: Within three months, Sabrina will grasp and release objects using her whole hand in 4 out of 5 opportunities with minimal assistance, promoting fine motor development during play.

Within four months, Sabrina will crawl forward on hands and knees for a distance of 6 feet in 4 out of 5 trials with no more than one verbal prompt, enhancing gross motor coordination and core strength.
Within three months, Sabrina will visually track a moving object across midline in 4 out of 5 opportunities with minimal cues, supporting visual-motor integration and ocular coordination.
Within five months, Sabrina will reach across midline to retrieve a toy in 3 out of 5 opportunities with moderate assistance, enhancing bilateral coordination and body awareness.
Within four months, Sabrina will demonstrate the ability to remove her socks with minimal assistance in 3 out of 5 opportunities, progressing in self-care and independence.

Within three months, Sabrina will tolerate touching different textured objects with her hands in 3 out of 4 opportunities with no distress, demonstrating improved sensory processing and tactile regulation.
Within five months, Sabrina will participate in social play activities with a peer or caregiver for at least 5 minutes in 4 out of 5 play sessions, fostering social engagement and interactive play.
Within six months, Sabrina will use a spoon to scoop and bring food to her mouth with moderate assistance in 3 out of 5 opportunities, working towards self-feeding proficiency.
